alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Teller (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 08 at 9:47AM MST until December 08 at 10:15AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Fremont County in central Colorado... Southwestern Teller County in central Colorado... * Until 1015 AM MST. * At 946 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Victor to Canon City to 8 miles southwest of Royal Gorge, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Along Highway 50 between Texas Creek and Penrose. Locations impacted include... Florence, Victor, Royal Gorge, Canon City, and Penrose. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
